intro: Mallotus megadontus, commonly known as the broad-leafed mallot, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small yellow flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in lowland forests or along riverbanks. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
